author: mklement0
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

The default output formatting for `[System.Reflection.Assembly]` instances shows information that only applies to _Windows PowerShell_ (.NET Framework):

```powershell
PS>  [object].Assembly

GAC    Version        Location
---    -------        --------
False  v4.0.30319     /Users/mklement/.powershell-PREVIEW/System.Private.CoreLib.dll
```
* .NET Core / 5+ has no GAC, so this information is irrelevant.

* The `Version` property value is seemingly a fixed default value; it is unrelated to the assembly's actual version number.

Therefore:

* the `GAC` display column should be removed
* the `Version` display column should report the actual assembly version number.
* other meaningful display columns could be added.

Note that changing _output formatting_ is _not_ considered a breaking change - for-display formatting details aren't considered part of the backward-compatibility contract.

---

Written as of PowerShell Core 7.2.0-preview.9.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

```powershell
-------        ----

```

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body:
The Engine Working Group discussed this and agree we should change the formatted output.

The suggested properties to display are the file path and the properties from the assembly name, name, version, culture and public key.
